title: Unraveling in Guessing Games: An Experimental Study

p_0.5_condition.setting: Large classroom, subjects seated far apart.

p_0.66_condition.setting: Large classroom, subjects seated far apart.

p_1.33_condition.setting: Large classroom, subjects seated far apart.

steps: Subjects are seated in a large classroom far apart.
Participants are asked to choose a number in the closed interval [0, 100].
The winner is determined as the person whose chosen number is closest to the mean of all chosen numbers multiplied by a parameter p.
The guessing task is repeated for 4 rounds.
